content: Calling all documentathon folks! Zoom link for you incoming here!

https://github.com/macovedj/doink <--- creating components from core wasm modules and WIT files

GitHub - macovedj/doink
Contribute to macovedj/doink development by creating an account on GitHub.
^^^ was initially zig-centric but could easily be adapted to be more general I believe

First PR created: https://github.com/WebAssembly/component-model/pull/244

Point users towards the documentation by merlijn-sebrechts · Pull Request #244 · WebAssembly/component-model
The repository and the explainer are the second and forth result on Google when searching for "wasm component model". Since a lot of users actually want a high-level explanation instead of the desi...

First PR created!
https://github.com/bytecodealliance/component-docs/pull/40

Update CONTRIBUTING.md by divya-mohan0209 · Pull Request #40 · bytecodealliance/component-docs
Improved the structure of the contributor documentation by: Including section on pre-requisites Improving section on submitting changes Combining the existing sections into a single one detailing ...

We have been discussing that a SIG for documentation within the Bytecode Alliance would be helpful. Since many of us are gathered in person today, we are going to draft up a proposal for the group. Here is a HackMD to join to participate in the draft: https://hackmd.io/@kgoldenring/sig-docs

Proposal to Create SIG Docs - HackMD
or

Greetings all,

I am completely new to Wasm but very excited seeing the things it can do.
This video helped me understand well

I stumbled upon an event description that mentioned

Participants can contribute to our extensive library of documentation, assist with effective messaging, and create engaging blog posts.

Although I am new to Wasm, I am eager to write a beginner blog post or tutorial. Would anyone be able to suggest topics that the blog needs and point me in the right direction?

Thank you.
Hey there, I'd love to get involved in documentation and become a supporting member of it!

Hi everyone! It has been awhile since we drafted the charter for SIG docs at Componentize the World. The time has come to get the engine going on SIG meetings. If you are interested in joining the inaugural meeting or participating asynchronously in SIG docs, join the #SIG Documentation channel
